sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) reported its Q3 2025 earnings, highlighting significant operational improvements, including increased operating cash flow and adjusted EBITDA, despite headwinds in the Taiwanese two-wheeler market. The company emphasized its strategic focus on product innovation, cost optimization, and strengthening its battery swapping network, aiming for network profitability by 2026 and company-wide profitability by 2028. CEO Henry Chiang and CFO Bruce Aitken addressed the recent stock decline after a reverse split, reaffirming confidence in the company's long-term fundamentals and growth prospects in urban electrification across Asia.

feed.title: Gogoro Releases Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. (Nasdaq: GGR) announced its Q3 2025 financial results, highlighting a significant increase in operating cash flow to $25.7 million for the first nine months of 2025, up from $13.3 million in the prior year. Despite a contraction in Taiwan's two-wheeler market, the company achieved strong non-IFRS profitability with adjusted EBITDA of $47.0 million for the nine-month period, expanding gross margins and reducing net loss. Gogoro also updated its 2025 revenue guidance to $270 million to $285 million, emphasizing operational efficiencies, product expansion, and a strengthened battery-swapping ecosystem.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Gogoro Q3 2025 reveals growth amid market challenges
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, showing significant growth in battery swapping service revenue and improved operational efficiency, despite a challenging market environment in Taiwan. The company achieved a 11.5% year-over-year increase in battery swapping service revenue and a gross margin of 12.2%, attributing these successes to effective cost management and an expanding subscriber base. Gogoro provided optimistic guidance, projecting network profitability by 2026 and positive free cash flow from its energy network by 2027, alongside plans to launch three new vehicle models in 2026.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc.'s (NASDAQ:GGR) 38% Dip In Price Shows Sentiment Is Matching Revenues
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc.'s stock price has fallen by 38% in the last month and 61% over the past year, leading to a low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.2x. This decline is attributed to falling revenues, which have decreased by 13% in the last year and 29% over three years. Analysts forecast modest revenue growth of 5.2% for Gogoro in the coming year, significantly less than the industry average of 12%, justifying the lower P/S ratio and investor pessimism.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) Short Interest Update
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) experienced a significant 95.3% drop in short interest, falling to 91,900 shares as of September 30th. Despite this, the company reported a loss of ($1.80) EPS and has a negative net margin of 46.72%. Institutional investment, particularly from Jane Street Group LLC, shows growing interest, with the firm increasing its stake by 81.1%.

feed.title: Gogoro Announces 1-for-20 Share Consolidation
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. announced a 1-for-20 share consolidation, effective October 6, 2025, to increase its per-share trading price and regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The consolidation, approved by shareholders in May 2025 and finalized by the Board in September, will not issue fractional shares and will proportionately adjust outstanding equity rights. Share trading will adjust under the existing "GGR" symbol with a new CUSIP, and public warrants ("GGROW") will continue trading with an adjusted exercise price.

feed.title: Electric Scooter Market Forecast Report and Company
feed.summary: The electric scooter market is projected to grow from US$26.73 billion in 2024 to US$55.01 billion by 2033, with an 8.35% CAGR, driven by demand for fuel-efficient vehicles, environmental concerns, and government incentives. Key players include Yadea, Niu, and BMW, with North America expected to hold the largest market share. Challenges like maintenance and competition from alternative transport persist despite technological advancements.

feed.title: BIZ BUZZ: Unwinding Gogoro … quietly
feed.summary: Globe Telecom-led 917Ventures is quietly pulling back from its Gogoro e-scooter operations in the Philippines due to dismal sales, closing its Greenbelt showroom and reducing battery stations. Separately, the article announces a new IMF resident representative for the Philippines in January 2025 and discusses mining industry stakeholders considering legal action to advance languishing projects.

feed.title: Gogoro and Cycle & Carriage Launch Battery Swapping with Three Smartscooters in Singapore
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. and its distribution partner Cycle & Carriage are launching battery swapping services and three Smartscooter models in Singapore this month. This initiative aims to support Singapore's Green Plan 2030 by introducing a new generation of electric two-wheeler urban transportation. The Gogoro Network offers a smart, safe, and continually optimizing battery refueling experience, expanding into a market with significant potential for electric vehicle adoption.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc. Announcement: If You Have Suffered Losses in
feed.summary: The Rosen Law Firm has announced an investigation into potential securities claims against Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ: GGR) after the company disclosed irregularities in its supply chain, leading to the inadvertent use of imported components in violation of Taiwanese government requirements for subsidies. These revelations caused a significant drop in Gogoro's stock price, and the firm encourages affected investors to contact them regarding potential compensation through a class action lawsuit.

feed.title: Gogoro Named to Fortune’s 2024 Change the World List
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. has been recognized on Fortune's 2024 Change the World List for its positive social and environmental impact through its battery swapping ecosystems for sustainable mobility. This marks Gogoro's first appearance on the prestigious list, which honors companies combining public-spiritedness with profit by addressing social problems. Fortune evaluated Gogoro based on its measurable social impact, business results, and degree of innovation.

feed.title: GGR INVESTOR ALERT: Bronstein, Gewirtz and Grossman, LLC Announces an Investigation into Gogoro Inc. and Encourages Investors to Contact the Firm!
feed.summary: Bronstein, Gewirtz and Grossman, LLC is investigating potential claims against Gogoro Inc. following reports that the company incorporated imported components into its vehicles, violating Taiwanese subsidy requirements. This investigation comes after Gogoro filed a Form 6-K acknowledging supply chain irregularities and the subsequent resignation of CEO Horace Luke, leading to a significant drop in its stock price. Investors who purchased Gogoro securities are encouraged to contact the firm to assist in the investigation.

feed.title: Gogoro to expand to Singapore in Q4
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. is set to launch its e-scooter models and battery-swapping services in Singapore in the fourth quarter of this year through an exclusive distribution partnership with Cycle & Carriage. This expansion follows positive feedback from a pilot program and securing a permit from Singapore's Land Transport Authority. The collaboration includes rolling out GoStations at Shell service stations and trialing Smartscooters with Foodpanda to gather insights on sustainable mobility.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc.'s (NASDAQ:GGR) top owners are individual investors with 47% stake, while 19% is held by private companies
feed.summary: Individual investors hold the largest stake in Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) at 47%, indicating significant influence from the broader public. Private companies own 19% of the company, with the top 9 shareholders collectively holding over half of the shares. Insiders also hold a considerable 12% stake, worth US$50 million in the US$423 million company.

feed.title: Gogoro Announces Exclusive Distribution Partnership with Cycle & Carriage in Singapore; Plans For Commercial Battery Swapping and Smartscooter Availability in Q4 2024
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. announced an exclusive distribution partnership with Cycle & Carriage (C&C) in Singapore for its battery swapping technology and Smartscooters, with a commercial launch planned for Q4 2024. This follows a successful pilot program with foodpanda riders that showed high satisfaction. C&C also partnered with Shell Recharge to establish battery swapping GoStations at Shell service stations, with the first GoStation expected by August 2024.

feed.title: Gogoro to receive investment from Gold Sino Assets
feed.summary: Electric scooter maker Gogoro Inc. announced it will receive a US$50 million capital injection from Gold Sino Assets Ltd. Gold Sino will acquire over 32.5 million newly issued common shares at US$1.5377 each. This investment aims to support Gogoro's continued business expansion and its goal to build smarter, sustainable cities.

feed.title: Sumitomo Corporation, Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd. (SMFL) and Gogoro Inc. to Explore First of its Kind Partnership to Accelerate Gogoro's Global Business Expansion
feed.summary: Sumitomo Corporation, Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd. (SMFL), and Gogoro Inc. are exploring a new partnership to accelerate Gogoro's global business expansion. This collaboration aims to leverage Gogoro's Smart Batteries and battery swapping technology to expand Sumitomo and SMFL's mobility business and create new revenue streams from second-life battery usage. The non-binding MOU signals a focus on sustainable energy and transportation solutions in densely populated cities, utilizing Gogoro's innovative ecosystem and data insights.

feed.title: Gogoro announces major partnership to help accelerate global expansion
feed.summary: Gogoro has announced a major partnership with Japanese giants Sumitomo Corporation and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd. (SMFL) to accelerate its global business expansion. This agreement will enable Sumitomo and SMFL to utilize Gogoro's Smart Batteries and battery-swapping system, extending beyond light electric vehicles and into new mobility and second-life battery use cases. The collaboration aims to leverage Sumitomo's vast reach and SMFL's financing expertise to establish a new asset-light expansion model for Gogoro's battery technology, creating new business opportunities and advancing a battery circular economy.

feed.title: Gogoro Unveils New Flagship Smartscooter, Pulse
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. (Nasdaq: GGR) has unveiled its new flagship Smartscooter, the Pulse, which features an aerodynamic design and a hyperdrive powertrain enabling it to reach 0-50km/h in 3.05 seconds. The Pulse integrates advanced features such as an active-matrix lighting system, a 10.25-inch panoramic HD touch display powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon QWM2290 digital chassis, and Apple Wallet and Apple Find My integration. The Smartscooter is expected to begin shipping in Taiwan in late Q2 2024, aiming to set a new standard for high-performance electric two-wheelers.

feed.title: Qualcomm launches Snapdragon digital chassis for ICE and electric two-wheelers
feed.summary: Qualcomm Technologies has expanded its Snapdragon Digital Chassis portfolio with new QWM2290 and QWS2290 platforms designed for ICE and electric two-wheelers, micro-mobility, and other motorized vehicles. These platforms aim to enhance safety, infotainment, cloud-connected digital services, personalization, and convenience. The company is collaborating with OEMs and ecosystem partners, including Gogoro, to accelerate the digital transformation of these vehicle segments.

feed.title: Gogoro e-scooters are coming to the Philippines in 2023
feed.summary: Gogoro electric scooters, known for their popularity in Taiwan, are set to launch in the Philippines later in 2023 through a joint venture between Globe’s 917Ventures Inc., Ayala Corporation, and Gogoro Network, forming Gogoro Philippines. This partnership will oversee the importation, sale, distribution, operation, and maintenance of Gogoro’s e-scooters, including the battery swapping technology and stations. The initiative marks Globe’s entry into the climate tech industry, aiming to provide eco-friendly transport solutions and leverage Gogoro's successful battery swapping system from Taiwan.

feed.title: Gogoro Inc. (NASDAQ:GGR) Q2 2023 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. provided insights into its Q2 2023 performance, emphasizing its ongoing efforts in the Indian market with government support from Maharashtra, and the continued growth of the EV market in Taiwan. The company also highlighted its innovative approach to battery lifecycle management, exploring solutions for battery reuse in UPS and storage applications after their mobility life. Lastly, Gogoro touched on product improvements, technological upgrades, and localization of manufacturing to reduce costs.

feed.title: Gogoro to execute $1.5B EV Mega Project in Maharashtra
feed.summary: The Indian State of Maharashtra and Gogoro Inc. announced a partnership for an 'Ultra Mega Project' involving a $1.5 billion investment over eight years. This project will establish manufacturing facilities for vehicles, smart battery packs, and battery swap stations, alongside deploying an open and accessible battery swapping infrastructure in Maharashtra, expecting to create 10,000 direct and indirect jobs. The initiative, considered one of India's largest EV investments, aims to create a smart battery ecosystem and accelerate foreign direct investment into the region.

feed.title: India’s State of Maharashtra and Gogoro to Partner On ‘Ultra
feed.summary: The Indian State of Maharashtra and Gogoro Inc. are partnering on an ‘Ultra Mega Project’ exceeding $1.5 billion over eight years to establish a smart battery infrastructure, including manufacturing and battery swapping stations, in Maharashtra. This initiative aims to deploy open and accessible battery swapping infrastructure starting in late 2023, creating approximately 10,000 direct and indirect jobs and positioning Maharashtra as a leader in sustainable transportation and EV adoption in India. The project includes significant financial incentives and support from the Maharashtra government.

feed.title: Gogoro Begins Battery Swapping in India
feed.summary: Gogoro has launched its battery swapping platform and Smartscooters in Delhi NCR, India, partnering with Zypp Electric for last-mile deliveries. The initiative includes four battery swapping stations in Gurgaon and two in Delhi, aiming to accelerate the adoption of sustainable electric two-wheel transportation in the rapidly growing Indian EV market. This expansion leverages Gogoro's proven battery swapping technology, which has already facilitated over 450 million swaps globally, to provide a quick and efficient refueling solution for delivery riders.

feed.title: Gogoro begins battery swapping in India | Unveils 6 swapping stations in NCR
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc. has launched its battery-swapping platform and Smartscooters in Delhi NCR, unveiling six battery-swapping stations as part of a pilot program with Zypp Electric focusing on last-mile delivery. This initiative aims to accelerate the shift to sustainable electric two-wheel transportation in India by providing a quick and convenient battery-swapping solution. The company emphasizes the efficiency and sustainability benefits for delivery operators in India's growing EV market.

feed.title: Gogoro Applauded by Frost & Sullivan as Global Leader in
feed.summary: Frost & Sullivan has recognized Gogoro with the 2023 Global Company of the Year Award for battery swapping in electric two-wheel vehicles, and its GoShare service with the 2023 Asia-Pacific Entrepreneurial Company of the Year Award. Gogoro is lauded for its innovative battery swapping platform, the Gogoro Network, which supports over 527,000 riders and has performed more than 425 million battery swaps, significantly reducing carbon emissions. GoShare, utilizing Gogoro's technology, offers an accessible and sustainable urban mobility solution that has facilitated over 26 million trips in Taiwan.

feed.title: India’s State of Maharashtra Announces Strategic Energy
feed.summary: The State of Maharashtra, India, has partnered with Gogoro Inc. and Belrise Industries to develop a $2.5 billion battery swapping infrastructure over eight years. This joint venture aims to deploy the world's largest sustainability-focused portable energy system, fostering smart electric vehicle manufacturing and job growth in the region. The initiative seeks to accelerate the transition to sustainable cities and address energy challenges through open and accessible battery swapping and smart battery stations.

feed.title: Gogoro and Belrise Industries to build $2.5 billion battery swapping infrastructure in Maharashtra
feed.summary: Gogoro and Belrise Industries have partnered with the Maharashtra government to invest approximately US$2.5 billion over eight years to build a battery swapping infrastructure across the state. This strategic energy partnership aims to deploy Gogoro's smart energy ecosystem, including smart battery stations and swapping technologies, to foster smart sustainable mobility solutions, accelerate job growth, and promote EV manufacturing within Maharashtra. The project is expected to begin deployment in 2023, positioning Maharashtra as a leader in sustainable energy and smart city development.

feed.title: Kwang Yang looking to unseat Gogoro by 2024
feed.summary: Kwang Yang Motor Co aims to overtake Gogoro Inc as Taiwan's leading electric scooter vendor by 2024, driven by increasing brand awareness and sales of its new Ionex Air model. The company plans to expand internationally, focusing on India and Europe, while overcoming challenges like chip shortages and establishing brand recognition as a market newcomer.

feed.title: Singapore’s Land Transport Authority Awards Gogoro With
feed.summary: Gogoro has been awarded a sandbox pilot by Singapore's Land Transport Authority (LTA) to deploy and validate its battery swapping ecosystem for smart mobility. This initiative involves a partnership with Jardine Cycle & Carriage, with its subsidiary Cycle & Carriage becoming the exclusive distributor of Gogoro's electric scooters and operator of its battery swapping infrastructure in Singapore. The pilot aligns with Singapore's Green Plan 2030 and aims to provide sustainable transportation solutions for urban fleets.

feed.title: GOGORO DEBUTS ON NASDAQ
feed.summary: Gogoro Inc., a global technology leader in battery swapping ecosystems, has become a publicly listed company on the Nasdaq Global Select Market. Its ordinary shares and warrants now trade under the ticker symbols "GGR" and "GGROW" respectively, following its merger with Poema Global on April 4, 2022. The company, backed by world-class investors, aims to transform urban mobility with its sustainable solutions for electric two-wheel vehicles.
